intro: Stigmaphyllon gymnopodum, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and often have a velvety texture. Stigmaphyllon gymnopodum is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
